Articles.Content:
The "Aftermath" video is rather an excellent way to revive his channel. Looks like he's on vacation for another month now (sounds like he needs some leisurely downtime) so we can get busy firing up the hype train for his inevitable KSP 1.0 adventures.

IMHO, this guy does some of the most cinematically beautiful KSP videos out there. Long may it be so.

Please direct all hype energies to my official hype thread here-

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120056-Home-of-the-Macey-Dean-Hypetrain%21-Macey-dean-is-back%21%21%21](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120056-Home-of-the-Macey-Dean-Hypetrain%21-Macey-dean-is-back%21%21%21)

I did say there were already others, zoo.

\*returns to building\*

> 
> I did say there were already others, zoo.
> \*returns to building\*

Yes and I'm rectifying those issues.
Could we get the threads merged perhaps?

WHAT?! He's back?! He didn't die?!

omg omg omg omg omg omg
Threads on the same subject have been merged.
Ok all hype activity shift it here. I'm still leading the hype train to LAYTHE COLONY!! #SpiritofKerbin

I am very happy he is back. Because of him I have played with space carriers, fighters, weapon systems, and so forth. Because of his series I have tried things and selected goals I would never had before. Wonder how the new equipment and such will change his designs.

I'll try recreating a spaceship from E:D in KSP. Probably the Imperial Clipper. Will send you the picture and file when (and if) I'm done.

Edit: ***Proof of concept*** done. It's ***mostly a crude imitation, no weapon systems, and no lifter stage***, so you can customize it to your liking from here. ***I'll be slowly finishing it as time will allow me to.*** [Download](https://www.dropbox.com/s/p0z9u6l0mpalf5c/Imperial%20Clipper.craft?dl=0)

![latest?cb=20150207165803](http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/elite-dangerous/images/6/6e/Clipper3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150207165803)![screenshot0_zpsb0guhr7i.png](http://i1026.photobucket.com/albums/y330/Marlowe345/screenshot0_zpsb0guhr7i.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-09T10:30:53Z" title="05/09/2015 10:30  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 9, 2015</time> by Marlowe345**

Honestly, Macey Dean was the reason I even got KSP. I had literally never heard of it until I stumbled across one of his videos showcasing his awesome battles, and I have loved that stuff since! Macey, welcome back!

i first heard of ksp from kurtjmac, and i new then that it was a good game and i wanted it.

but when i saw macey's channel, i became a abscessed with it and went crazy untill i finally got it.

i guess what i'm trying to say is that... kurtjmac introduced me to ksp, but macey made me get it.

If you haven't heard or seen, Macey Dean is a youtuber who used to make massive flagships with missiles and fighters using Stock KSP in 0.20, after months and months of waiting, it now seems he has returned to youtube.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Nc94UQOmkdc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

I think hes overrated, but we know. there was a big thread about it somewhere around here with alot of fan discussion and some other forum user made flagships, but Im not sure where that went. lemme dig it up for you.

EDIT: here is the link for it, but it needs administrator access? [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120056-Home-of-the-Macey-Dean-Hypetrain!-Macey-dean-is-back!!!/page3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120056-Home-of-the-Macey-Dean-Hypetrain!-Macey-dean-is-back!!!/page3)

So maybe a friendly mod can explain.

EDIT2: maybe this thread I found on google was merged into one of the links in the below post, thus rending the link invalid. anywho that second link below has a few pages of good content.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-28T03:18:45Z" title="05/28/2015 03:18  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 28, 2015</time> by r4pt0r**

I believe this topic has already been covered several times, though I'm sure Macey appreciates the free advertising.
